comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: HMAS Manunda had an interesting career as a liner and a hospital ship during WW2, famously at the attack on Darwin, the occupation of Japan, and returning PoWs to Australia, which may be what she was doing at the time of this photo (1946). en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Manunda and [http://www.flickr.com/photos/41311545@N05/4998036713/]

comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Thanks for posting this info, very interesting.

AB

comment.author: 35179849@N08
comment._content: The problem with this being Jones Bay,   is that if you look at the angle of the Harbour Bridge,  it is too far to the north.   I think this is the bay right outside the casino.

comment.author: 83037459@N08
comment._content: The date on flikr says 'c.1946', but the photo has '1934' backwards in the bottom left hand corner.
